metadata.prompt:
Apply this to the file and previous info You are extracting structured order data from the text
below (PDF + email). Use all available information from the PDF, the email body, header,
and signature. If something is not in the document, return null. Return only valid JSON in the
structure shown.
Output format:
{{
"buyer_company_name": "",
"buyer_person_name": "",
"buyer_email_address": "",
"order_number": "",
"order_date": "",
"delivery_address_street": "",
"delivery_address_city": "",
"delivery_address_postal_code": "",
"products": [
{{
"product_position": "",
"product_article_code": "",
"product_quantity": ""
}}
]
}}
Extraction rules:
Buyer info
Company name: from header, company block, “Firma,” or email signature
Person name: sender name, signature, “Kontakt,” “Ihr Sachbearbeiter,” or “unser Zeichen”
Email: main buyer email from the email header or signature
Order details
Order number: look for “Bestellung,” “Order No.,” “Bestellnummer”
Order date: from “Belegdatum,” “Bestelldatum,” “Order date,” or email subject
Delivery address
Use the buyer’s delivery address if shown. If no delivery address is listed, use the buyer’s
company address from the signature. Extract street, city, and postal code. Ignore OTTA
addresses.
Products
Extract one entry per product line:
Position: “Pos” or the line number
Quantity: from “Menge,” “Stück,” “Qty,” or “Quantity”
Article code (final corrected rule):
If the product line contains “Ihre Materialnummer,” “Ihre Mat.-Nr.,” or “Ihre Artikelnummer,”
use that value as product_article_code.
Otherwise, check the product description block (the line(s) directly below the main product
row).
If a standalone article-like code appears there (letters + numbers), use this code.
This code takes priority over all table numbers.
If no description-block code exists, use the article number from the main product table row
(Art.-Nr., Li.-Art.-Nr., Materialnummer, etc.).
If multiple codes appear, choose the one closest to the product name in the description.
If no article code appears anywhere, return null.
If anything is unclear, return null.
Process this document and the Sales email :
